section1.heading: What are cookies?
section1.text1: Cookies are files saved on your phone, tablet or computer when you visit a website.
section1.text2: They store information about how you use the website, such as the pages you visit.
section1.text3: Cookies are not viruses or computer programs. They are very small so do not take up much space.

section2.heading: How we use cookies

list.item2: measure how you use our website, such as which links you click on (analytics cookies), if you give us permission

section2.text2: We do not use any other cookies, for example, cookies that remember your settings or cookies that help with health campaigns.
section2.text3: We sometimes use tools on other organisations' websites to collect data or to ask for feedback. These tools set their own cookies.

details.summary: Cookies needed for the NHS website to work

rows: Remembers if you used our cookies banner
If you do not interact with cookie banner it will expire when you close the browser. If you interact with the banner the cookie will expire after 3 months.
